reviews.title: 5 star prices, 2 star food
reviews.text: Indigo Bay is the best of the Bazaruto resorts, but as an Indian Ocean Island Resort it does not come close to similarly priced resorts in Mauritius, Maldives etc.

reviews.title: Superb!
reviews.text: Forget about the "seafood buffets". When we visited this hotel for 7 days in Feb 06, we were very dissapointed when, on our first night, we were offered a choice of 2 starters, salad or quiche, fried chicken or beef for main course, and a choice of fruit salad or slice of cheese cake for dessert. The standard of food and presentation was 1 star at best.

reviews.title: Superb!
reviews.text: We asked to speak to the restaurant manager, and he informed us that as there were only a few guests they decided to do away with all buffets!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Indigo Bay for 6 nights as part of our 2 week honeymoon. We really liked Indigo Bay and they made us feel very special on our honeymoon.
reviews.title: Lovely

likes.disliked: — Some of the staff were just going through the motions.

reviews.text: The resort is quite big. It has 2 pools, 3 restaurants, tennis courts, a mini golf course and a magnificent Spa with fantastic views! I believe it is the biggest resort in Mozambique and wouldn't have normally chosen such a place, but were transferred here after our original hotel 'had problems'! When I say big, it actually only has 44 rooms and can hold a maximum of 114 guests, but it was still bigger than where we would normally stay. We were lucky though, as it was their low season, there couldn't have been any more than about 50 guests there, and it often felt as though there were more staff than guests!
reviews.title: Tranquil and stunning

reviews.text: The staff were extremely attentive (A little too, if that is at all possible!) and it got a little annoying after a while, when they would run to your table, just to pull out your chair for you...but I can hardly complain about that! The only real complaint I would have about the staff, is that they were quite soulless and I felt that they were just going through the motions.
reviews.title: A Quiet Haven of Beauty and Relaxation

likes.liked: — Clean, spacious, newly renovated and gorgeous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked a beach chalet, but were upgraded on arrival to a Luxury Bay View Villa, which was just incredible. We had a massive room with a great view, a massive terrace with a plunge pool...we couldn't believe our luck!
reviews.title: Try it !

reviews.text: As we were on honeymoon they gave us a few 'treats'. They left gifts on our bed on the 1st night and we had a romantic sunset cruise on a Mozambican Dhow. When we got back to our room from our cruise, we found it lit with candles, petals scattered over the room and a hot bath filled with petals!! It was lovely. That was then followed by a private dinner and more small gifts. It did really make it special!
reviews.title: Absolutley Fantastic
